intro: Pentacalia medullosa, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is typically found in moist, wooded areas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar vine-like growth habits. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and botanical gardens.
